{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3184604,"name":"Adi Prajapati","username":"adiprajapati","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/adiprajapati/{size}/237675_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-10T00:11:03.482Z","cooked":"

Does anyone anyone know if controller drift matters when using swerve drive?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-04-10T00:26:48.247Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":58,"reads":327,"readers_count":326,"score":355.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":433626,"topic_slug":"xbox-controller-drift-on-swerve-drive","display_username":"Adi Prajapati","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56762,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mechanical/Electrical Lead"},"post_url":"/t/xbox-controller-drift-on-swerve-drive/433626/1","custom_user_title":"Mechanical/Electrical Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3184611,"name":"","username":"wanderingcarrot","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/35a633/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-04-10T00:23:06.896Z","cooked":"

Controller drift matters no matter what. Controller drift is a problem of getting the wrong input from your controller. If you’re using that input to drive a output, you will have drift issues. The only mitigation of drift issues is deadbanding on axis values to stop any values that are too low from driving the motors.

imagine you’re climbing onto the charge station and you cant stop moving because of stick drift. Dont ruin your match because of a poor controller.

Yes, if drift is bad you won’t be able to drive your robot.

Take this video as an example. A wire got snagged on the drive joystick when we plugged it in, causing the idle position to be skewed.

yeah our team actually had a match this year where at the end, my friend (primary driver) had the robot randomly jerking full speed into the community area. luckily we weren’t climbing that game, but we couldn’t figure out the problem for a while. finally i remembered that the controllers we were using were kinda old, and checked driverstation when we made an input, and sure enough the controller went full throttle at the slightest tap. that’s an extreme case with a really bad controller, but yeah it definitely matters

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-06-03T17:41:09.352Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":184,"readers_count":183,"score":51.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":433626,"topic_slug":"xbox-controller-drift-on-swerve-drive","display_username":"Zach","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58913,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4415 Leader"},"post_url":"/t/xbox-controller-drift-on-swerve-drive/433626/5","custom_user_title":"4415 Leader","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3212214,"name":"","username":"Thor5090","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thor5090/{size}/226064_2.png","created_at":"2023-06-03T17:54:13.904Z","cooked":"

Last year we lost a match due to controller drift. The lead mentor said the controller should’ve been marked, and I said no throw it in the trash. That mentor later pulled it out of the trash to possibly use so I went and cut the cord off of it and said if he was worried about it I’d buy a new controller. There’s only so many matches in a season and we don’t need to possibly cut that short due to a stupid controller.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-06-03T17:54:13.904Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":166,"readers_count":165,"score":48.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":433626,"topic_slug":"xbox-controller-drift-on-swerve-drive","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53198,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"My views are mine and mine alone"},"post_url":"/t/xbox-controller-drift-on-swerve-drive/433626/6","custom_user_title":"My views are mine and mine alone","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3212225,"name":"Tom Line","username":"Tom_Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png","created_at":"2023-06-03T19:40:13.932Z","cooked":"

I’m seeing a number of ideas in this thread about what drift is.

One person talks about a faulty potentiometer not having a middle area.

Another talks about a miss-initialized gamepad.

Controller drift is equally confused on the internet. I suspect because people don’t really understand how controllers work. When a controller initializes and runs correctly, but loses accuracy in the sticks over time, i consider that drift.

I have seen poor quality game pads (the common Logitech ones have bad dead zones and inconsistent response). But i have never actually experienced a game pad losing accuracy during a match. A gyro, yes. A thumb stick, not so much.

As the Logitech pads wear they also get “sticky” and do not freely return to the exact same zero location. As a result, the game pass will initialize in the wrong location.

High quality controllers often use better plastics in the thumb pivot. That reduces wear and helps.

But the vast, vast majority of what i have seen teams call drift is actually inconsistent returning to zero by the thumb stick.

Heavier springs can also help this. Or just get high quality controllers and replace them often.

Our controllers get thrown away the first time they don’t return to center. As someone else said, controllers aren’t worth a match.

Checking your controllers is as easy as zeroing them then moving them around and watching their decimal output.

when you use a rotation controller & it accidentally crosses the threshold telling your bot to always face a specific direction if you don’t hold it down then yes it does become an issue, but just in general drift tends to cause issues with controlling bots

I am familiar with what drift is. The improper initialization’s effect was more or less equivalent to extreme controller drift. I have used controllers that suffered from genuine controller drift, and while it was nowhere near as bad, it was still very similar. The video serves as an exaggerated example to better show what controller drift is capable of
